hero.title: Hello, my name is Jefferson Espinoza
hero.tagline: I am a Developer who is currently based in Long Island, New York.

skills.title: Full Stack
skills.description: As a full-stack developer, I have hands-on experience working with both front-end and back-end technologies, building seamless, end-to-end web applications.

skills.title: Growth Minset
skills.description: I am a self-taught developer who thrives in learning new programming languages, tools, and concepts through hands-on experience and community resources.

skills.title: Strategy Minded
skills.description: As a strategy-minded developer, I approach problem-solving with a planned, goal-oriented mindset, focusing on long-term scalability and efficient decision-making.

playlists.title: Deep House
playlists.description: Deep house is my go-to for debugging. The repetitive rhythms create a sense of structure, helping me spot patterns in errors, while the calming vibe reduces stress and keeps my mind clear. It's perfect for getting into that flow state and blocking out distractions so I can focus on fixing those pesky bugs.

playlists.title: Harvey Specter
playlists.description: This playlistâ€”because even programmers need a little swaggerâ€”provides a jolt of upbeat, motivational music perfect for tackling creative blocks and staying committed to that 'impossible' deadline. It's the soundtrack to feeling like you just closed a massive deal (even if it's just a pull request). The subconscious association with success fuels the drive to conquer coding challenges, while the right tunes surprisingly sharpen focus and boost creative thinking. Basically, it's positive reinforcement on repeat, because who *doesn't* want to feel like they're closing deals while they're coding?
